official-title.#text: To authorize the continued use of certain water diversions located on National Forest System land in the Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness and the Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness in the State of Idaho, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

short-title.#text: Idaho Wilderness Water Resources Protection Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Treatment of existing water diversions in Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness and Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness, Idaho

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall issue a special use authorization to the owners of a water storage, transport, or diversion facility (in this section referred to as a

quote.#tail: ) located on National Forest System land in the Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness and the Selway-Bitterroot Wilderness for the continued operation, maintenance, and reconstruction of the facility if the

text.#text: the facility was in existence on the date on which the land upon which the facility is located was designated as part of the National Wilderness Preservation System (in this section referred to as
the facility has been in substantially continuous use to deliver water for the beneficial use on the owner’s non-Federal land since the date of designation;
the owner of the facility holds a valid water right for use of the water on the owner’s non-Federal land under Idaho State law, with a priority date that predates the date of designation; and
it is not practicable or feasible to relocate the facility to land outside of the wilderness and continue the beneficial use of water on the non-Federal land recognized under State law.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Idaho Wilderness Water Resources Protection Act/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: In a special use authorization issued under
allow use of motorized equipment and mechanized transport for operation, maintenance, or reconstruction of a facility, if the
the use is necessary to allow the facility to continue delivery of water to the non-Federal land for the beneficial uses recognized by the water right held under Idaho State law; and
the use of nonmotorized equipment and nonmechanized transport is impracticable or infeasible; and
preclude use of the facility for the storage, diversion, or transport of water in excess of the water right recognized by the State of Idaho on the date of designation.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Idaho Wilderness Water Resources Protection Act/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: In a special use authorization issued under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines necessary, to reduce impacts to wilderness values set forth in

text.#text: require or allow modification or relocation of the facility in the wilderness, as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: if the beneficial use of water on the non-Federal land is not diminished; and
, in whole or in part, by the grant of a reciprocal right-of-way, or by reduction of fees or other costs that may accrue to the owner to obtain the authorization for water facilities.

text.#text: require that the owner provide a reciprocal right of access across the non-Federal property, in which case, the owner shall receive market value for any right-of-way or other interest in real property conveyed to the United States, and market value may be paid by the
